alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Northern Grafton; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 11:46AM EST until January 13 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Wet snow and sleet. Additional snow accumulations up to one inch for a storm total of 4 to 8 inches and sleet accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central and western Maine and northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...A fast moving system will bring a period of light to moderate snowfall to the region. Travel will be impacted due to snowfall accumulations on untreated roads. Periods of moderate and heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
